name: Overture Musical Score
summary: Learn about .OVE files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Professional composers, music teachers, and music students use Overture to create, edit, and publish musical scores. Because Overture allows composers to play scores in time with video, it is especially popular among film score composers.

Prior to version 5, Overture saved composers' scores as OVE files. In version 5, Sonic Scores replaced the OVE format with the .OVEX format. However, current versions of Overture can still open OVE files.
NOTE: Sonic Scores was previously known as GenieSoft.

instructions: You can open an OVE file with Sonic Scores Overture (Windows, macOS). To do so:
Select File → Open... from Overture's menu bar.
Navigate to and open your OVE file.
Version 5 of Overture can convert OVE files to the following formats:
